root_gloss: to apply). Denominal verb from (Ottoman) Turkish müracaat ‘appeal’, ultimately from the Arabic root rǧʕ in the meaning ‘to demand, claim (restitution from s.o.)’ (DMWA 379). The pharyngeal is unexpected, as this sound is alien to the Turkish phonemic inventory and therefore not present in the putative etymon. It is possible that the present form in Ṭuroyo reflects a local accent in contact with Arabic and other languages that include this phoneme, perhaps via Kurm. miraceet ‘request, appeal’ (s.v., DFK 1019 ‘requête, recours’, marked as juridical

Preterit.turoyo: Mraǧaʕlan lu qonsolos d Almanya d obeli wiza. İlyas p.c

Preterit.turoyo: Mraǧaʕli li dawle doboli mʕawana. İlyas p.c Mraǧaʕlan huwwe daṣṭə̀r diḏan edi aṯina. Nisane 2018_07_08_au_NE_1F
translations: We applied, they gave us permission, then we came.

tokens.value: ‘We applied, they gave us permission, then we came.’

Preterit.text: Mraǧaʕli li dawle doboli mʕawana. (İlyas p.c) Mraǧaʕlan, huwwe daṣṭə̀r diḏan, edi aṯina. ‘We applied, they gave us permission, then we came.’ (Nisane 2018_07_08_au_NE_1F ln. 245)

Infectum.turoyo: Kǝmraǧʕina aḥna kul šato li dawle d obo mʕawana li zraʕa.İlyas p.c
